title: Ethics panel meeting on TMC MP Mahua Moitra postponed
description: The Lok Sabha ethics committee meeting on the cash-for-query allegations against TMC MP Mahua Moitra has been postponed to November 9. The committee has finished its enquiry and will make its recommendation after members ranged along party lines in the last meeting. BJP members are in the majority and are likely to take a grim view of the charges against Moitra. She has been accused of asking questions in Lok Sabha to target the Adani group for bribes.

title: Grain subsidy to cost government 11L crore over 5 years
description: The Indian government is planning to extend the free foodgrain scheme, Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana, for the next five years. The total subsidy for this extension is estimated to be around Rs 11 lakh crore. Under this scheme, 80 crore poor beneficiaries are entitled to receive 5kg of rice, wheat, and coarse grain for free. The subsidy expenditure is expected to increase by 5-6% annually due to the rise in minimum support price and economic costs. The government may also need to address the surplus of fortified rice stocks.

title: Congress government in Karnataka ready to accept its own caste survey
description: The Karnataka State Commission for Backward Classes plans to submit a “fresh” socio-economic educational survey — commonly called the caste census — to the Congress government in a bid to overcome “technical issues” with the original blueprint readied three years ago.

title: 2 teens missing in Manipur, tension grips state yet again
description: After two teenagers went missing, the Manipur grips new tension and protests triggered in the city. On Sunday morning, two teenage boys went mysteriously missing and police said that their phones were found wrapped in a bag near a fuel station in Senapati district headquarters. The Police said that both were from the Lamshang locality of Imphal West and were last seen in CCTV footage riding the bike in Kanglatongbi area, near Sekmai, in Imphal West around 10:15 am on Sunday.

title: Delhi government announces odd-even curbs after Diwali
description: Delhi will implement the odd-even traffic restriction plan from November 13 to 20 to combat air pollution after Diwali. Electric and CNG-run cars and two-wheelers are likely to be exempted from the restrictions. Physical classes in schools, except for students of classes X and XII preparing for exams, will be suspended. The government will assess the situation after November 20 to decide whether to extend the restrictions. Vehicular emissions contribute significantly to Delhi's pollution levels. The government has also implemented other long-term measures to mitigate pollution.

title: New CIC Samariya is first Dalit to hold post
description: The Central Information Commission (CIC) in India has finally appointed a new chief and two new information commissioners after being headless for over a month. Heeralal Samariya, a retired IAS officer and former information commissioner, has been sworn in as the new chief. Anandi Ramalingam and Vinod Kumar Tiwari have also been sworn in as information commissioners. However, the CIC is still not at full strength as per the provisions of the Right to Information Act.

title: As China woos Bhutan, Delhi & Thimphu pledge to boost ties
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi met with Bhutanese King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck to reaffirm India's commitment to their friendship and cooperation. The two countries announced measures to expand trade and connectivity, including a proposed cross-border rail link and an immigration check-post for third country nationals. India also agreed to provide financing for Bhutan's projects and schemes, and increase scholarships for Bhutanese students studying in India.

title: LeT man behind Jammu and Kashmir army camp attack killed in PoK
description: Khwaja Shahid, a commander of the terrorist group Lashkar-e-Taiba, has been found beheaded near the Line of Control in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. He was one of the masterminds behind the 2018 attack on an Indian Army camp in J&K's Sunjuwan. The circumstances surrounding his abduction and killing remain unclear, and no group has claimed responsibility. This follows a series of assassinations of wanted terrorists who had sought refuge in Pakistan and other countries.

title: Cong plays different strokes in Raj & Chhattigarh to continue on the pitch
description: The Congress party in India has adopted different strategies in the states of Rajasthan and Chhattisgarh to secure a repeat term in power. In Rajasthan, the party has decided to retain a majority of its MLAs, trusting that Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot's appeal and record will help lift the party's chances. Meanwhile, in Chhattisgarh, the party has dropped a significant number of MLAs to counter local anti-incumbency sentiment. Congress believes that by replacing these MLAs, it can dilute the negative sentiment and maintain its position in power.

title: Congress slams EC for cancelling meet on misuse of agencies
SC: What’s up in Madras HC? How can CJ wield such power?
description: The Supreme Court has supported Madras High Court judge Justice N Anand Venkatesh's decision to examine the validity of a trial judge's quick acquittal of Tamil Nadu education minister K Ponmudy and his wife in a corruption case. Justice Venkatesh had questioned the unusual speed at which the trial judge proceeded with the case and delivered a lengthy judgment just before retiring.

title: Government’s plan for rear seat alarm system put off for now
description: The Indian government has postponed its plan to introduce an 'alarm' feature for rear seatbelts, focusing instead on making six airbags mandatory in cars. The proposal for the alarm system, aimed at encouraging rear-seat passengers to wear seatbelts, was also put on hold. Currently, the law only requires seatbelt reminders for drivers and front seat passengers, with little enforcement for rear seat passengers. Road safety advocates are concerned about the delay and urge the government to prioritize this safety measure to prevent road accidents.

title: ED, Income Tax contesting polls for BJP: Chhattisgarh CM Baghel
description: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has demanded action from the Election Commission against attempts to damage his government's reputation on the eve of assembly polls. Baghel accused the BJP of using the Enforcement Directorate (ED) and income tax department as weapons to contest the election on their behalf. He also accused the BJP of having ties with the Mahadev betting app and questioned why no action had been taken against them.

title: BJP-Sena-NCP alliance shines in Maharashtra rural polls
description: The mood in Maharashtra’s ruling camp was upbeat on Monday after the gram panchayat election results showed the Mahayuti alliance — BJP, Shiv Sena and Ajit Pawar faction of NCP — was way ahead of the Maha Vikas Aghadi, bagging 1,350 of the 2,359 gram panchayats that went to polls on Sunday.The results were still to be updated at the time of going to press.

title: Meiteis fleeing conflict to miss Mizoram polls
description: The Meitei people living and working in Mizoram fled the state due to the ethnic conflict in Manipur and many sought refuge in Assam between May and July, fearing attacks by locals. Many of them are registered voters in Mizoram, but will miss the polls on Tuesday in their adoptive state. Most of these Meiteis are from southern Assam and some of them, like Okram Sarat Singha, maintain contact with their Mizo friends via phone. But Sarat has not received encouragement from them to return to Mizoram and vote.

title: Ahead of COP meet, India to expand coal power capacity
description: India is planning to increase its coal-fired power generation capacity to meet the surge in electricity demand driven by its growing economy. Power Minister R K Singh stated that an additional 30,000 MW of thermal generation capacity needs to be constructed, on top of the 50,000 MW already in progress. Singh emphasized that India would not compromise on power availability for growth, even if it means adding more coal-based capacity.

title: 2 Maoist blasts rock Bastar on eve of election, 4 injured
description: Maoist IED explosions left two polling personnel and an equal number of paramilitary jawans wounded in Bastar's Kanker and Narayanpur districts on Monday, a day before the first phase of voting in Chhattisgarh. Maoists have called for a boycott of the assembly polls. In the fortnight leading up to the polls, five people, including two BJP leaders, were murdered by Maoists in Bastar. The first phase involves 20 constituencies, 12 of which are in the Maoist-affected Bastar division.

title: Terror funding: SIA files chargesheet against Pak-based terrorist
description: The State Investigation Agency (SIA) in Kashmir has filed a chargesheet against three individuals in a terror funding case. The accused include a Pakistan-based terrorist handler and two residents of Srinagar. The duo from Srinagar allegedly raised funds from Saudi Arabia and Oman as part of a conspiracy with the terrorist handler. The funds were laundered through the banking channels and deposited into the accounts of family members of terrorists to support their activities in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Israel cuts off north Gaza as Palestinian toll tops 10,000
description: Israeli forces have cut off northern Gaza from the rest of the territory and launched intense air strikes, preparing for a push into Gaza City. The death toll in Palestine has exceeded 10,000, with over 4,100 children and 2,600 women among the casualties. Israel has vowed to crush Hamas, and the war is expected to escalate as troops enter Gaza City. The Israeli military said it had successfully encircled the north and south of Gaza, and ground troops have taken over a Hamas compound.

title: Israeli air strike on Gaza's hospital kills one, injures several others
description: An Israeli air strike that hit a building belonging to Gaza's Al Shifa hospital killed one Palestinian and wounded several others, according to the spokesman of Gaza's ministry of health. The spokesperson further said that the building is hosting 170 injured and other displaced people. ​Israel has launched air and ground attacks on the Gaza Strip following a cross-border attack by Hamas on October 7.

title: It was disgraceful, lost all respect for Shakib: Angelo slams B'desh over 'time out' drama
description: A furious Angelo Mathews lashed out at Bangladesh skipper Shakib Al Hasan and his team after his 'timed out' dismissal snowballed into a major controversy at the World Cup on Monday. After the Sri Lanka all-rounder became the first international cricketer to be 'timed out' for not being ready to face the ball within two minutes of the fall of a wicket, Mathews hit out at Bangladesh over their 'disgraceful' actions at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi.

title: 'I don't know if it's right or wrong': Shakib on Mathews' dismissal
description: Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan said he "didn't know if it was right or wrong" and that the umpires asked if he was "serious" when he controversially appealed to have Sri Lanka batsman Angelo Mathews given "timed out" in the World Cup on Monday. Mathews became the first player in the 146-year history of international cricket to suffer the dismissal when he exceeded the two-minute limit to take strike when he arrived at the crease to bat.

title: World Cup: Shakib leads Bangladesh to win after 'time out' drama
description: Angelo Mathews became the first batter to be timed out in international cricket as Bangladesh officially knocked Sri Lanka out of the World Cup with a 3-wicket win in a dramatic match, which was held amid severe air pollution in New Delhi on Monday. Despite the AQI hovering close to the 400 mark, it was business as usual after the two teams braved toxic conditions as Bangladesh bowled Sri Lanka out for 279 in 49.3 overs, with Charith Asalanka scoring a 105. But Bangladesh chased down the target with 53 balls to spare.

title: Watch: Mathews gestures 'timed out' after dismissing Shakib
description: Sri Lankan all-rounder Angelo Mathews had become the first player in the 146-year history of international cricket to be given timed out as he had taken more than the regulation time to take strike when he came out to bat. Mathews  later exacted sweet revenge for his 'timed out' dismissal by claiming the wicket of Bangladesh skipper Shakib Al Hasan during the ODI World Cup match. Mathews failed to reach the crease within the stipulated time of two minutes.

title: Gujarat: Tailor inspired by crime shows arrested for posing as IPS officer
description: The impersonator, identified as Mohammad Sarmaj Alam, hailing from Bihar and with an education up to the 10th grade, was found to have a penchant for donning police attire and parading in public places to impress onlookers, stated DCP Bhagirath Gadhavi.

title: 'Bharat Atta' launched at Rs 27.50/kg: How to buy it
Trump takes the stand in New York civil case alleging financial fraud
description: Former President Donald Trump has begun testifying in his civil fraud trial, defending himself against allegations that he inflated his net worth. This trial brings together his legal troubles and his political ambitions, as he seeks a return to the White House while facing multiple criminal indictments. Trump's testimony gives him the opportunity to use the witness stand as a campaign platform, but it also poses risks for a businessman known for his freewheeling rhetoric. The trial will cover topics such as Trump's role in his company's decision-making and the valuation of his properties.

title: 'Apocalyptic' : People react to sky turning red in Bulgaria
description: The northern lights, or aurora borealis, made a rare appearance in Bulgaria, spreading across the country and captivating social media users. People described the red aurora as "apocalyptic" and "spooky" while others expressed excitement. The phenomenon was also observed in other countries including Romania, Hungary, and the United Kingdom. The northern lights are typically seen near the Earth's magnetic poles but can occasionally be seen in more temperate areas. The colors of the auroras are determined by the gas molecules they encounter in the atmosphere.

title: Jailed Iranian Nobel laureate Mohammadi goes on hunger strike
description: Nobel Peace Prize winner Narges Mohammadi has begun a hunger strike in an Iranian jail in protest against the lack of access to medical care. The women's rights advocate, who won the award earlier this month, has reportedly been denied treatment for heart and lung conditions as she refused to wear a headscarf during a hospital visit. Mohammadi is currently serving multiple sentences totalling 12 years imprisonment on charges including spreading propaganda against the Islamic Republic.

title: ATS arrests 2 ISIS suspects for UP terror plot
description: Arsalan is a BTech in petroleum chemical engineering from a private university, while Tariq is pursuing a BCom degree through distance learning.

title: Lucknow: Walmart techie loses Apple Macbook in aircraft
description: Identified as Mudit Rai (30), the victim spent hours convincing airline crew and Lucknow airport operator staff that his belongings were stolen, and they must help him to trace the accused passenger.

title: 'Chalo ji...bass yehi bacha tha!!!': Social media reacts after Angelo's dismissal
description: Sri Lanka's Angelo Mathews failed to reach the crease within the stipulated time of two minutes. As per the MCC laws, a batsman is required to be prepared to face the next ball within three minutes of a dismissal. However, in the specific playing conditions outlined for the ICC World Cup 2023, the time limit for the incoming batsman is just two minutes.

title: Mizoram, Chhattisgarh to kick off 5-state poll battles on Nov 7
description: The final assembly elections of 2023 are set to take place in Mizoram and Chhattisgarh on November 7. In Chhattisgarh, the ruling Congress will face off against the BJP, with the Aam Aadmi Party and BSP also fielding candidates. In Mizoram, the ruling MNF will aim to retain power against opposition parties. The campaigning in both states has involved heated political clashes and the highlighting of key issues. The results for these elections, along with those for Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, and Telangana, will be announced on December 3

title: AAP urges Kejriwal to continue as Delhi CM even if he is arrested
description: Last week, Kejriwal received a summons from the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for questioning regarding its money laundering investigation linked to the alleged excise police scam.

title: How an 'afternoon nap' re-energised Kohli vs Pak in T20 WC
description: India's victory against arch-rivals Pakistan in the 2022 T20 World Cup was a moment of jubilation for every Indian cricket fan. One particular highlight that left an indelible mark on the match was Virat Kohli's fearless approach against the fiery Pakistani pacer Haris Rauf.

title: Message to Iran? US deploys nuclear sub in Middle East
description: The US has deployed a nuclear-powered submarine to the Middle East as a deterrence measure amid rising tensions. The submarine is part of the US's "nuclear triad," which includes land-based, airborne, and submarine-based nuclear weapons. In addition to the submarine, a nuclear-capable B-1 bomber has also been sent to the region. The US has moved over 17,350 military personnel, carrier strike groups, and fighter jets to the Middle East. The US believes that Iranian allies may escalate the Israel-Hamas conflict, and they are prepared to respond if necessary.

title: Driver held for murder of geologist in Bengaluru
description: The victim, Prathima K S, who worked in the Department of Mines and Geology, had employed the driver, Kiran, for four years. However, he was replaced and subsequently let go from his position about a week before the incident.

title: Why these 6 states may decide who will be next US president
description: According to a survey by The New York Times and Siena College, if the 2024 US presidential elections were held today, Donald Trump would defeat Joe Biden with nearly 300 electoral votes. Trump has a lead among Hispanic voters, men, and rural regions, while Biden still has support from women. The survey also found that black voters are showing unprecedented support for Trump. However, Biden's campaign spokesperson cautioned that predictions can change over time. The survey polled around 600 registered voters in six battleground states.

title: Punjab AAP MLA Jaswant Gajjan Majra 'picked up' by ED: Reports
description: The AAP leader, who wished to remain anonymous, stated that the ED had taken Punjab AAP MLA Jaswant Singh Gajjan Majra into custody on Monday.

title: When Sourav Ganguly almost became first to be 'timed out'
description: The incident brought back the memories dating back to 16 long years when former India captain Sourav Ganguly survived a timed-out dismissal as he had to rush onto the pitch after the fall of a wicket during a South Africa Test at Cape Town in 2007. The MCC law states that the batter should be ready to receive the next ball within 3 minutes of the dismissal. But according to ICC World Cup 2023 playing conditions, the time limit for the batter is just two minutes.

title: Race on to recover 'holy grail of shipwrecks'
description: Colombia is working to recover a 300-year-old sunken treasure, the Spanish galleon San José, which is valued at up to $20 billion. President Gustavo Petro has instructed his government to speed up the process and aims to raise the ship from the Caribbean Sea before his term ends in 2026. There is a legal dispute over the ownership of the treasure, with a US company called Sea Search Armada suing the Colombian government for half of the estimated $20 billion value.

title: Indian man in US gets life in jail for brutally killing wife
description: An Indian man was sentenced to life imprisonment for brutally murdering his wife in 2020 by stabbing her 17 times and then driving over her body, according to a media report. According to The Sun Sentinel newspaper, Philip Mathew pleaded no contest on Friday to the first-degree murder of his wife Merin Joy. The plea agreement protected him from the prospect of receiving the death penalty. Joy, who was preparing to leave the abusive relationship, was murdered by her husband at the parking lot of Broward Health Coral Springs, where she was working as a nurse.

title: Explained: What is ‘Timed Out’ rule in cricket
description: The Angelo Mathews' 'timed out' dismissal, during the Bangladesh-Sri Lanka ODI World Cup match in Delhi, sparked a controversy as well as a need of an explanation about the rule which has never been used in international cricket until today. The former Lankan captain took over two minutes to assume the batting position due to helmet issues. During this delay, Bangladesh skipper Shakib Al Hasan made an appeal, which was upheld by the on-field umpire.

title: Bus rams into waiting passengers killing 3
description: The deceased were identified as M Kumari (46) and her grand-son K Ayansh alias Cherry (seven-months-old), both passengers and Y Veeraiah (24), an outsourcing employee with RTC.

title: Lokesh Batta on Isha Malviya's Udaariyaan's controversial BB17 stay
description: Isha Malviya's controversial relationship in Bigg Boss 17 has sparked negative reactions, especially after Samarth Jurel's intimate behavior with her on national television. Isha's Udaariyaan co-actor Lokesh Batta expressed support for her and revealed that her parents are extremely upset with the show. Isha's father is on the verge of depression, while her mother feels responsible for the situation. Lokesh also criticized Abhishek Kumar and Samarth for ruining Isha's image and questioned why other contestants aren't advising her.

title: 'Yes, Kohli is selfish': Prasad slams Hafeez for his remark
description: Former Indian fast bowler Venkatesh Prasad vehemently criticized former Pakistani all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez for his remarks about Virat Kohli's approach to reaching his century during the World Cup match against South Africa on Sunday. Hafeez commented that Kohli displayed a selfish attitude when he was nearing his record-equalling 49th ODI century, opting for singles instead of boundaries in the 49th over to achieve this milestone.

title: Mathews becomes first to be 'timed out' in international cricket
description: The incident occurred during the Bangladesh-Sri Lanka ODI World Cup match at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi. After the dismissal of Lankan batter Sadeera Samarawickrama in the 25 over of the innings, Angelo Mathews was the next man in but he seemed to have issues with the strap of his helmet and was late on taking the strike. The former Lankan captain took over two minutes to assume the batting position due to helmet issues. During this delay, Bangladesh skipper Shakib Al Hasan made an appeal, which was upheld by the on-field umpire.

title: Earthquake tremors felt in Delhi-NCR, second in a week
Elvish Yadav case: IO shunted, case shifted
description: SI Sandeep Chaudhary, who was in-charge of Noida's Sector 49 police station, has been reassigned to police lines due to his perceived inability to effectively manage crime in his jurisdiction, as stated by a police spokesperson on Sunday night.

title: Pollution: No physical classes in Delhi schools, barring classes 10 and 12, until Nov 10
description: On Monday morning, pollution levels in Delhi-NCR were found to be approximately seven to eight times higher than the safe limit set by the government.

title: What is 'pig butchering' and why China is cracking down on it
'BJP, ED the same', says Chhattisgarh CM on betting app case
description: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel has criticized the Election Commission for not taking note of the press release issued by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to defame someone. Baghel also strongly objected to the release of video by the BJP which shows Mahadev App accused Shubham Soni speaking against the chief minister. "The press release was issued by ED and the video was released by the BJP, so it is now clear that the ED is BJP and BJP is ED," Baghel said.

title: Helicopter carrying KCR develops snag
description: According to sources, the helicopter had to turn back to the chief minister's farmhouse just 10 minutes after takeoff due to a technical glitch.

title: Jonty Rhodes takes a dig at SA's loss with Royal Enfield example
description: Former South African cricketer Jonty Rhodes made a comical connection between South Africa's poor batting performance against India in the Cricket World Cup and his Royal Enfield Hunter motorcycle.

title: RBI’s rate hiking days may not be over yet
description: RBI not done with rate hikes? Global markets are closely monitoring the tense geopolitical situation in Europe and the Middle East, as it could impact oil prices and prompt action from the Reserve Bank of India. Morgan Stanley warns that sustained oil price increases could strain India's economic stability and currency.

title: Rashmika Mandanna reacts to her viral deepfake video
description: Actress Rashmika Mandanna  urges that ee need to address this as a community and with urgency before more of us are affected by such identity theft.

title: World Cup: How India and Pakistan can clash in semi-final
description: India secured the top spot in the ICC ODI World Cup standings after a 243-run victory over South Africa. This marks India's eighth consecutive victory in the tournament. South Africa and Australia are likely to finish in the second and third positions, respectively. Australia has two matches left, facing Afghanistan and Bangladesh, and a win will secure a top three finish in the league stage. The fourth and final spot is currently contested by New Zealand, Pakistan, and Afghanistan.

title: Mundra is India’s first port to handle cargo volumes of 16 MMT in a month
description: Mundra Port, owned by the Adani Group, has set a new milestone by handling 16.1 million metric tonnes of cargo in October, making it the highest volume ever handled by any port in India. The port has witnessed double-digit growth in handling containers, liquids, and gas, and has expanded its cargo portfolio.

title: Delhi odd-even scheme: What we know so far
description: The air quality in Delhi remained in the 'Severe' category on Sunday though with a marginal dip in the overall Air Quality Index (AQI) recorded at 410 against 504 on Saturday, as per System of Air Quality Forecasting and Research (SAFAR-India).

title: Google is telling users if these apps are secure or not, here's how
description: Google is introducing a new banner in the Play Store for VPN apps to indicate that they have undergone an independent security review. This is part of Google's efforts to keep the Play Store safe for users and developers. The banner will provide users with a simplified view of which apps have been validated against global security standards. Users can also find additional technical assessment details in the App Validation Directory to make more informed decisions about VPN apps. VPN providers like NordVPN, Google One, and ExpressVPN have already undergone independent security testing.

title: Byju’s in talks to sell US unit epic for $400m to Joffre
description: Indian education provider Byju's is in advanced discussions to sell its US-based digital reading platform, Epic!, for approximately $400 million to Joffre Capital. The sale would help Byju's raise funds to repay a disputed $1.2 billion term loan. Other potential buyers, including Duolingo, have also expressed interest in acquiring the platform. Byju's has been facing financial pressures and is trying to reduce losses after the online learning boom during the pandemic subsided.

title: Rajasthan polls: Teens join crime gangs, flaunt caste on social media, sparking worries
description: A disturbing trend in Sikar district, India, has seen scores of teenagers willingly join gangs involved in criminal activities and organized crime. Social media, the desire for influence, and community support are the common factors that draw young adults to these criminal gangs. The failure of administrations and people's representatives to address this issue has led to the rise of several criminal gangs in the region. As the assembly polls approach, concerned citizens and businesspeople are raising concerns about the deep nexus between criminals and the political class.

title: 'No shame in accepting': Virat on India's loss to Pak in 2021 T20 WC
description: Virat Kohli has long moved on from India's humiliating 10-wicket loss to arch-rivals Pakistan in their opening match of the 2021 T20 World Cup in Dubai. On that fateful day, Kohli acknowledged that Pakistan completely outplayed India, securing their inaugural victory in a World Cup game (both ODI World Cups and T20I World Cups). One year later, in the 2022 T20 World Cup, Virat avenged the 2021 defeat in style. He played a memorable knock of 82 not out off 53 balls to hand India a thrilling four-wicket win at the jam-packed Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG).

title: NCR pollution: Odd-even scheme back in Delhi from Nov 13-20 amid worsening air quality
description: The odd-even vehicle rule will be implemented in Delhi from November 13-20 due to worsening air quality. Schools will be closed, except for Class 10 and 12. The air pollution levels in Delhi-NCR have reached alarming heights, with the region being enveloped in a hazardous toxic haze for seven consecutive days. The government has implemented strict restrictions, including the prohibition of trucks known to contribute to pollution. The air quality index has exceeded the safe limit, prompting the activation of emergency measures.

title: World Cup 2023: How Kohli 'helped' Disney+Hotstar set new record
description: The India vs South Africa match during the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023 drew a peak concurrency of 4.4 crore viewers on Disney+ Hotstar. India scored 326 runs in the first innings, with Virat Kohli scoring 101 off 121 balls. South Africa could only manage 83 runs, with India winning the match by 243 runs. This is the second time Disney+ Hotstar has broken its viewership record during the World Cup. The platform is offering free streaming of the World Cup and has introduced new features to enhance the cricket-watching experience.

title: Ponting hails Kohli as 'absolute best' batter in the world
description: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has praised Virat Kohli as the "absolute best" batter in the world, citing his extraordinary overall record. Kohli recently equaled Sachin Tendulkar's 49 ODI centuries with a brilliant unbeaten 101 against South Africa in a World Cup match. This century solidified Kohli's status as one of the greatest players of the modern era. Ponting stated that Kohli's overall batting record is incredible, and his 49th ODI century came in 175 innings less than Tendulkar.

title: Scientists warn of bigger earthquake risks in Nepal after recent tremors
Apple sacks employee over antisemitic Instagram message
description: Natasha Dach's post was widely condemned by social media users, who tagged Apple and its CEO Tim Cook, and demanded action against her. Some also questioned her loyalty to the US and her sympathy for Hamas, the Palestinian militant group that is designated as a terrorist organization by the US and many other countries. Dach, who worked as a technical specialist and manager apprentice at Apple, deleted her Instagram and LinkedIn accounts after receiving backlash for her remarks. She was also removed from Apple's official employee directory.

title: How to use Google Maps to plan your journey and save time
description: Google Maps offers a feature called "Departure Time" that uses real-time traffic data to provide precise estimations of travel duration and the ideal time to leave. To use this feature, open the Google Maps app, set your destination, choose your transportation mode, and tap on the "Directions" button. Then, enter your desired departure time and Google Maps will display predicted traffic conditions and suggested routes. Once you confirm your departure time, you can follow the suggested route and receive real-time traffic updates during your journey. This feature is particularly helpful for daily commutes, business meetings, and road trips.

title: 'It's Rohit's idea': Rathour lauds captain's attacking approach
description: Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma has been praised by batting coach Vikram Rathour for his aggressive approach and consistent performance in the ICC World Cup 2023. Despite scoring only one century and two fifties in eight matches, Sharma's dynamic starts have significantly benefited the Indian team. In a recent match against South Africa, Sharma's quickfire 40 off 24 balls set the tone for India, leading to a 326 for 5 victory. Rathour attributed Sharma's attacking approach to his initiative and his ability to lead with his action.

title: IMD forecasts widespread rainfall in Kerala over next 5 days
description: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted widespread rainfall in Kerala over the next five days due to a cyclonic circulation in the region. Moderate to medium rainfall is expected, with heavy rains at isolated places. In the previous month, most areas in Kerala received normal rainfall, with a few districts experiencing excess rainfall. Wayanad was the only district with deficient rainfall until November 5.

title: India’s 1st 100% FDI in defence project cleared
description: India has granted permission to Sweden's Saab to establish a new facility for manufacturing rockets, marking the first instance of 100% foreign direct investment (FDI) in the defence sector. The FDI proposal, valued at under Rs 500 crore, was cleared last month.

title: Virat Kohli joins Sachin Tendulkar in elite club
description: Virat Kohli on Sunday notched his 49th one-day international century, a feat that brought him on par with Sachin Tendulkar's legendary all-time record. Celebrating his 35th birthday, Virat achieved this milestone in his 277th innings during the World Cup match against South Africa in Kolkata, whereas Tendulkar required over 400 innings to achieve the same milestone. During the course of his 101 not out knock, Virat also has become the second batter after Tendulkar to complete 6,000 runs in ODIs at home.

title: Rajinikanth's 'Sivaji' to rerelease in Telugu states on Dec 9
description: To celebrate Rajinikanth's 78th birthday in December, two of his movies, 'Sivaji The Boss' and 'Muthu', will be re-released in theaters in Telugu and Tamil respectively. 'Sivaji The Boss', directed by Shankar and released in 2007, was a commercial success and will be screened in select theaters from December 9. Rajinikanth is currently working on two upcoming films, 'Thalaivar 170' and 'Thalaivar 171', and will also appear in a cameo role in the sports drama 'Lal Salaam' in January 2024.

title: F1 2023: Verstappen wins at Sao Paulo GP
description: In the end, it was current world champion Verstappen who went on to clinch his second win of the weekend after coming out on top in Saturday’s Sprint.

title: 'Jahaan se woh ball...': Malik explains why Jadeja is tough to face
description: Ravindra Jadeja, an all-rounder for India, contributed significantly to the hosts' unbeaten run against South Africa, scoring an unbeaten 29 off 15 balls and taking his maiden World Cup five-wicket haul. His 5 for 33 was the second World Cup fifer by an Indian spinner after Yuvraj Singh's 5/31 in the 2011 edition against Ireland. India skipper Rohit Sharma praised Jadeja's understanding of his role and team expectations, while former Pakistan cricketers also praised his toughness on turning pitches.

title: World Cup: King level with God
description: Virat Kohli celebrated his birthday by scoring his 49th ODI century, equalling Sachin Tendulkar's record. Tendulkar was among the first to congratulate Kohli and encouraged him to break his record. Kohli battled hard on a difficult pitch and had to change his game plan to adapt. He was supported by Shreyas Iyer, who played aggressively. Kohli's century came at a strike rate of 83.47, with 10 boundaries but no sixes. Despite reaching this milestone, Kohli remained focused on the task of winning the match.

title: 749 Hindu kids enrolled in 30 Uttarakhand madrassas: Report
Stranded in Israel with son, Nagpur woman asks for help
description: Sivan Jacob Jaiswal, an Indian citizen residing in Israel, is stranded in the war-torn country with her son after being denied evacuation by Indian authorities. Despite being an Overseas Citizen of India, she was unable to board Air India's emergency flights. Sivan's husband, who is in Nagpur, is anxiously waiting for their return. Sivan had traveled to Israel in January to complete passport formalities for her son but got stuck due to the October 7 attack by Hamas. Her husband remains hopeful that they will be able to return soon.

title: 'Yeh planning se hota hai...': Akram on India's unbeaten run
description: India's unstoppable performance in the ICC ODI World Cup has sparked questions among opponents, fans, and experts about how to stop the Indian team. After a 243-run victory against South Africa, India appear unstoppable in the tournament. Pakistan's bowling legend Wasim Akram believes that every team in the World Cup, including New Zealand, South Africa, and Pakistan, must be thinking the same question at the moment, as they are looking very good. The hosts' recent victory against South Africa has further fueled the question.

title: Delhi and NCR put on alert for health emergency
description: The Indian health ministry has advised all states to strengthen support at district and hospital levels to manage acute and chronic conditions caused by air pollution. Short-term exposure to high levels of pollutants can cause irritation of the eyes, nose, throat, and skin, as well as breathing difficulties and chest discomfort. Vulnerable groups, such as children and the elderly, can experience more severe effects. The government has also called for the establishment of surveillance on air pollution-related illnesses and the sharing of findings for timely action. A study found that 1.7 million deaths in India in 2019 were attributable to air pollution.

title: Ker: 2 Assam natives found dead with cuts on necks
World Cup: India, you are witnessing something special!
description: India continued their dominant run in the ICC ODI World Cup with a crushing 243-run victory over South Africa. Virat Kohli celebrated his 35th birthday by equalling Sachin Tendulkar's record of 49 ODI hundreds. Kohli remained unbeaten on 101 as India posted a total of 326 for five. In response, South Africa were bowled out for just 83 runs in 27.1 overs. Ravindra Jadeja was the pick of the Indian bowlers, taking five wickets for 33 runs. India's win takes their tally to eight consecutive victories in the tournament.

title: Only regional parties good for states: KCR
description: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao has stated that regional parties are better than national parties as they understand the pain of their states and people. He questioned the efforts of national parties like Congress and BJP in serving Telangana and urged people to choose a party that is good for the state. He also emphasized the need for a mature democracy and advised voters to consider the history and work done by each political party before casting their votes.

title: Yamuna e-way accidents up 30% in 2023
description: Accidents on the Yamuna Expressway have increased by 30% this year, according to data from the Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority. However, fatalities have decreased, with 80 deaths reported until October. The number of injuries also increased by 7% compared to the previous year. The data shows that accidents, deaths, and injuries on the expressway have been fluctuating since 2016. The authorities have taken measures to enhance road safety, including installing more cameras and replacing barbed wires with thrie beams.

title: Explained: Epic vs Google antitrust case and why it is important
description: Epic Games and Google are set to face off in a federal court on November 6 in an antitrust trial similar to the one involving Apple. Epic has accused Google of abusing its power in the Android apps market by charging fees and forcing developers to use its own payment system. Epic wants to offer a separate payment option to avoid paying Google.

title: TCS announces new LeAD head, HR head sends note to employees
description: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has appointed Elizabeth Mathew as the head of TCS LeaD, a program aimed at promoting diversity and leadership at the senior level. Mathew, a TCS veteran, will be responsible for nurturing leadership talent and overseeing diversity and inclusion initiatives. This appointment follows a series of leadership changes made by CEO K Krithivasan. Additionally, TCS announced several changes to senior management personnel, including the retirement of chief technology officer K Ananth Krishnan in 2023.

title: Fiery Red Sunday: Max farm fires, in all Pb dists
description: Crop residue burning cases in Punjab have spiked to 3,230, the highest so far this season, with all 23 districts reporting fires for the first time. Sangrur district, the native area of Punjab's chief minister, has been leading in setting fire to paddy straw for eight consecutive days. Out of the total cases, more than 75% were reported in the last eight days. However, the number of burning cases is lower than the previous two years, with a 40% decrease from last year. Paddy arrivals in mandis have reached 70% of the procurement target.

title: Infosys expands operations in Europe with a new centre, to hire 500
description: Infosys is expanding its presence in Europe by opening a new proximity center in Sofia, Bulgaria. The center will focus on next-gen digital technologies such as AI, automation, IoT, and software engineering. It will attract and up-skill 500 new employees over the next four years. The center aims to support global and European customers in their digital transformation efforts, particularly in the manufacturing, retail, and financial services sectors. The move is seen as a testament to Infosys' commitment to fostering talent and contributing to the local economy in Bulgaria.

title: Bad air: Why Delhi is country’s burning sensation
description: Delhi is experiencing its fourth consecutive "severe" air day, which could be one of the longest streaks in the city. The air quality is expected to remain in the severe category until November 8. The previous longest streaks lasted seven days. The Air Quality Index (AQI) has been consistently high, with readings of 392, 402, 468, 415, and 454 in recent days. Experts warn that prolonged smog episodes can have serious health consequences and call for aggressive measures to reduce pollution.

title: World Cup: Knew I will take wickets at Eden says Ravindra Jadeja
description: Ravindra Jadeja took a career-best five wickets for 33 runs in India's World Cup match against South Africa. He dismissed the suggestion that he was spurred on by coach Rahul Dravid's praise, stating that they knew the Kolkata pitch would be slow and helpful to spinners. Jadeja also credited the pacers for taking quick wickets, giving the spinners an advantage.

title: World Cup: Coach Rajkumar Sharma recalls Virat Kohli's work ethic
description: Virat Kohli's childhood coach, Rajkumar Sharma, expressed his overwhelming joy as Kohli scored his 49th ODI century. Sharma believes that Kohli's achievement of matching Sachin Tendulkar's record is a blessing. He recalled their early meeting when he recognized Kohli's talent and praised his dedication and work ethic.
